description: VMware Fusion and VMware Workstation are virtualization applications that allow you to run multiple operating system VMs on a single machine. When you take a snapshot of a VM, the software creates a frozen saved state of the VM and saves it as a VMSN file. The software also creates a VMSD file to store metadata for the VMSN file.

When taking a snapshot of a VM, VMware virtualization software creates a VMSN file and VMSD file in the VM file.
